arabicText: ۞ قُلْ مَن يَرْزُقُكُم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ قُلِ ٱللَّهُ ۖ وَإِنَّآ أَوْ إِيَّاكُمْ لَعَلَىٰ هُدًى أَوْ فِى ضَلَـٰلٍۢ مُّبِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim,	“Who	provides	you	sustenance	
from	the	sky	and	the	earth?”	Proclaim,	
“Allah	-	and	indeed	either	we	or	you	are	
upon	guidance,	or	in	open	error.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāō	kaun	jo	tumheñ	rozi	detā	hai	
āasmānoñ	aur	zameen	se	tum	khud	
farmāō	Allāh	aur	be-shak	ham	yā	tum	yā	
to	zaror	hidāyat	par	haiñ	yā	khuli	gumrāhi	
meiñ.

arabicText: قُل لَّا تُسْـَٔلُونَ عَمَّآ أَجْرَمْنَا وَلَا نُسْـَٔلُ عَمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim,	“You	will	not	be	questioned	
regarding	the	sins	you	assume	we	have	
committed,	nor	will	we	be	questioned	
regarding	your	misdeeds.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāō	ham	ne	tumhāre	gumān	meiñ	
agar	koyi	jurm	kiyā	to	us	ki	tum	se	pooñch	
nahiñ	na	tumhāre	kotakoñ	(kartotoñ)	ka	
ham	se	suwāl.

arabicText: قُلْ يَجْمَعُ بَيْنَنَا رَبُّنَا ثُمَّ يَفْتَحُ بَيْنَنَا بِٱلْحَقِّ وَهُوَ ٱلْفَتَّاحُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
Say,	“Our	Lord	will	bring	us	all	
together,	and	then	judge	truthfully	
between	us;	and	He	is	the	Best	Judge,	the	
All	Knowing.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāō	hamārā	Rab	ham	sab	ko	
jama'	kare	gā	phir	ham	meiñ	sachchā	
faisla	farmā	de	gā	aur	wohi	hai	badā	niyāō	
chukāne	wālā	(durust	faisla	karne	wālā)	
sab	kuchh	jānta.

arabicText: قُلْ أَرُونِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَلْحَقْتُم بِهِۦ شُرَكَآءَ ۖ كَلَّا ۚ بَلْ هُوَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
Say,	“(Dare	you)	Show	me	those	whom	
you	have	matched	with	Him	–	never!	
Rather	only	He	is	Allah,	the	Most	
Honourable,	the	Wise.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāō	mujhe	dikhāō	to	woh	sharik	
jo	tum	ne	us	se	milāye	haiñ	hisht	(hargiz	aisā	nahiñ)	balke	wohi	hai	Allāh	'izzat	wālā	ḥikmat	
wālā.

arabicText: وَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَـٰكَ إِلَّا كَآفَّةًۭ لِّلنَّاسِ بَشِيرًۭا وَنَذِيرًۭا وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ ٱلنَّاسِ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	O	dear	Prophet,	We	have	not	sent	you	
except	with	a	Prophethood	that	covers	the	
entire	mankind,	heralding	glad	tidings	and	warnings,	but	most	people	do	not	know.	(Prophet 
Muhammad – peace and blessings be upon him – is the Prophet towards all mankind.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	aey	Meḥboob	ham	ne	tum	ko	na	bhejā	magar	aisi	risālat	se	jo	tamām	āadmiyoñ	ko	gherne	
wāli	hai	khush-khabri	detā	aur	dar	sonata	lekin	bahut	log	nahiñ	jānte.

arabicText: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَـٰذَا ٱلْوَعْدُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ
englishTranslationText: And	they	say,	“When	will	this	promise	come,	if	you	are	truthful?
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	kahte	haiñ	ye	w'ada	kab	āaye	gā	agar	tum	sachche	ho.

arabicText: قُل لَّكُم مِّيعَادُ يَوْمٍۢ لَّا تَسْتَـْٔخِرُونَ عَنْهُ سَاعَةًۭ وَلَا تَسْتَقْدِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim	“For	you	is	the	promise	of	a	Day	which	you	cannot	postpone	by	one	moment	nor	can	
you	advance	it.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāō	tumhāre	liye	aik	aise	din	ka	w'ada	jis	se	tum	na	aik	ghardi	peeche	hat	sako	na	āge	
bardh	sako.

arabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَن نُّؤْمِنَ بِهَـٰذَا ٱلْقُرْءَانِ وَلَا بِٱلَّذِى بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ ۗ وَلَوْ تَرَىٰٓ إِذِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمُونَ مَوْقُوفُونَ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ يَرْجِعُ بَعْضُهُمْ إِلَىٰ بَعْضٍ ٱلْقَوْلَ يَقُولُ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱسْتُضْعِفُوا۟ لِلَّذِينَ ٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ لَوْلَآ أَنتُمْ لَكُنَّا مُؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	disbelievers	said,	“We	shall	never	believe	in	this	Qur’an	nor	in	the	Books	that	were	
before	it”;	and	if	only	you	see,	when	the	unjust	will	be	brought	before	their	Lord;	they	will	hurl	
allegations	on	one	another;	those	who	were	subdued	will	say	to	those	who	were	conceited,	“If	it	
were	not	for	you,	we	would	have	certainly	accepted	faith.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kāfir	bole	ham	hargiz	na	Imān	lāyeñ	ge	is	Qur’ān	par	na	un	Kitāboñ	par	jo	is	se	āage	thiñ	aur	
kisi	ṭaraḥ	tu	dekhe	jab	zālim	apne	Rab	ke	pās	khade	kiye	jāyeñ	ge	un	meiñ	aik	dosre	par	bāt	
dāle	gā	woh	jo	dabe	the	un	se	kaheñ	ge	jo	ooñche	khinchte	the	agar	tum	na	hote	to	ham	zaror	
Imān	le	āate.

arabicText: قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ لِلَّذِينَ ٱسْتُضْعِفُوٓا۟ أَنَحْنُ صَدَدْنَـٰكُمْ عَنِ ٱلْهُدَىٰ بَعْدَ إِذْ جَآءَكُم ۖ بَلْ كُنتُم مُّجْرِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Those	who	were	conceited	will	say	to	
those	who	were	subdued,	“Did	we	stop	
you	from	the	guidance	after	it	came	to	
you?	In	fact	you	yourselves	were	guilty!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	jo	ooñche	khinchte	the	un	se	kaheñ	
ge	jo	dabe	huye	the	kiyā	ham	ne	tumheñ	
rok	diyā	hidāyat	se	b'ad	iske	ke	tumhāre	
pās	āayi	balke	tum	khud	mujrim	the.

arabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱسْتُضْعِفُوا۟ لِلَّذِينَ ٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ بَلْ مَكْرُ ٱلَّيْلِ وَٱلنَّهَارِ إِذْ تَأْمُرُونَنَآ أَن نَّكْفُرَ بِٱللَّهِ وَنَجْعَلَ لَهُۥٓ أَندَادًۭا ۚ وَأَسَرُّوا۟ ٱلنَّدَامَةَ لَمَّا رَأَوُا۟ ٱلْعَذَابَ وَجَعَلْنَا ٱلْأَغْلَـٰلَ فِىٓ أَعْنَاقِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ ۚ هَلْ يُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Those	who	were	subdued	will	say	to	those	
who	were	conceited,	“Rather	it	was	your	
deceit	during	night	and	day,	for	you	
commanded	us	to	deny	Allah	and	to	set	up	
equals	to	Him”;	and	inwardly	they	began	
regretting	when	they	saw	the	
punishment;	and	We	placed	shackles	
around	the	necks	of	the	disbelievers;	what	
recompense	will	they	get	except	what	
they	used	to	do?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kaheñ	ge	woh	jo	dabe	huye	the	un	se	
jo	ooñche	khinchte	the	balke	rāt	din	ka	
dāōñ	(fareb)	thā	jab	ke	tum	hameñ	ḥukm	
dete	the	ke	Allāh	ka	inkār	kareñ	aur	us	ke	
barābar	wāle	thahrāyeñ	aur	dil	hi	dil	meiñ	
pachtāne	lage	jab	'aƶāb	dekhā	aur	ham	ne	
ṭāuq	dale	un	ki	gardanoñ	meiñ	jo	munkir	
the	woh	kiyā	badla	pāyeñ	ge	magar	wohi	
jo	kuchh	karte	the.

arabicText: وَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَا فِى قَرْيَةٍۢ مِّن نَّذِيرٍ إِلَّا قَالَ مُتْرَفُوهَآ إِنَّا بِمَآ أُرْسِلْتُم بِهِۦ كَـٰفِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	whenever	We	sent	a	Herald	of	
Warning	to	any	town,	its	wealthy	people	
said,	“We	disbelieve	in	what	you	have	
been	sent	with.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Ham	ne	jab	kabhi	kisi	shahar	meiñ	
koyi	dar	sunāne	wālā	bhejā	wahāñ	ke	
āasodoñ	(amiroñ)	ne	yahi	kahā	ke	tum	jo	
le	kar	bheje	gaye	ham	us	ke	munkir	haiñ.

arabicText: وَقَالُوا۟ نَحْنُ أَكْثَرُ أَمْوَٰلًۭا وَأَوْلَـٰدًۭا وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	said,	“We	are	greater	in	wealth	
and	children;	we	will	not	be	punished!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	bole	ham	māl	aur	aulād	meiñ	badh	
kar	haiñ	aur	ham	par	'aƶāb	honā	nahiñ.

arabicText: قُلْ إِنَّ رَبِّى يَبْسُطُ ٱلرِّزْقَ لِمَن يَشَآءُ وَيَقْدِرُ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ ٱلنَّاسِ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim	“Indeed	my	Lord	eases	the	
sustenance	for	whomever	He	wills	and	
restricts	it	for	whomever	He	wills,	but	
most	people	do	not	know.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāō	be-shak	merā	Rab	rizq	wasi'a	
kartā	hai	jis	ke	liye	chāhe	aur	tangi	
farmātā	hai	lekin	bahut	log	nahiñ	jānte.

arabicText: وَمَآ أَمْوَٰلُكُمْ وَلَآ أَوْلَـٰدُكُم بِٱلَّتِى تُقَرِّبُكُمْ عِندَنَا زُلْفَىٰٓ إِلَّا مَنْ ءَامَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَـٰلِحًۭا فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمْ جَزَآءُ ٱلضِّعْفِ بِمَا عَمِلُوا۟ وَهُمْ فِى ٱلْغُرُفَـٰتِ ءَامِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	your	wealth	and	your	children	are	
not	capable	of	bringing	you	near	to	Us,	but	
one	who	believes	and	did	good	deeds	(is	
brought	close);	for	them	is	double	the	
reward	–	the	recompense	of	their	deeds	
and	they	are	in	high	positions,	in	peace.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tumhāre	māl	aur	tumhāri	aulād	is	
qābil	nahiñ	ke	tumheñ	hamāre	qurb	tak	
pahuñchāyeñ	magar	woh	jo	Imān	lāye	aur	
neki	ki	un	ke	liye	donā	doon	(kayi	gunā)	sila	un	ke	'amal	ka	badla	aur	woh	bālā-khānoñ	meiñ	
amn-o-amān	se	haiñ.

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ يَسْعَوْنَ فِىٓ ءَايَـٰتِنَا مُعَـٰجِزِينَ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ فِى ٱلْعَذَابِ مُحْضَرُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	those	who	strive	in	Our	signs	in	order	to	defeat,	will	be	brought	into	the	punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	woh	jo	hamāri	āayatoñ	meiñ	harāne	ki	koshish	karte	haiñ	woh	'aƶāb	meiñ	lā	dhre	jāyeñ	ge.

arabicText: قُلْ إِنَّ رَبِّى يَبْسُطُ ٱلرِّزْقَ لِمَن يَشَآءُ مِنْ عِبَادِهِۦ وَيَقْدِرُ لَهُۥ ۚ وَمَآ أَنفَقْتُم مِّن شَىْءٍۢ فَهُوَ يُخْلِفُهُۥ ۖ وَهُوَ خَيْرُ ٱلرَّٰزِقِينَ
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāō	be-shak	merā	Rab	rizq	wasi'a	farmātā	hai	apne	bandoñ	meiñ	jis	ke	liye	chāhe	aur	
tangi	farmātā	hai	jis	ke	liye	chāhe	aur	jo	cheez	tum	Allāh	ki	rāh	meiñ	kharch	karo	woh	us	ke	
badle	aur	degā	aur	woh	sab	se	bahtar	rizq	dene	wālā.

arabicText: وَيَوْمَ يَحْشُرُهُمْ جَمِيعًۭا ثُمَّ يَقُولُ لِلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ أَهَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ إِيَّاكُمْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْبُدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	on	the	day	when	He	will	raise	them	
all,	and	then	say	to	the	angels,	“Did	they	
worship	you?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jis	din	un	sab	ko	uthāye	gā	phir	
farishtoñ	se	farmāye	gā	kiyā	ye	tumheñ	
poojte	the.

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ سُبْحَـٰنَكَ أَنتَ وَلِيُّنَا مِن دُونِهِم ۖ بَلْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْبُدُونَ ٱلْجِنَّ ۖ أَكْثَرُهُم بِهِم مُّؤْمِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	will	say,	“Purity	is	to	you	–	only	you	
are	our	Supporter,	not	they;	in	fact	they	
worshipped	the	jinns;	most	of	them	
believed	only	in	them.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	árz	kareñ	ge	pāki	hai	tujh	ko	tu	
hamārā	dost	hai	na	woh	balke	woh	jinnoñ	
ko	pojte	the	un	meiñ	aksar	unhiñ	par	
yaqeen	lāye	the.

arabicText: فَٱلْيَوْمَ لَا يَمْلِكُ بَعْضُكُمْ لِبَعْضٍۢ نَّفْعًۭا وَلَا ضَرًّۭا وَنَقُولُ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ ذُوقُوا۟ عَذَابَ ٱلنَّارِ ٱلَّتِى كُنتُم بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	this	day	you	will	not	have	the	power	to	
benefit	or	hurt	one	another;	and	We	shall	
say	to	the	unjust,	“Taste	the	punishment	
of	the	fire	which	you	used	to	deny!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	āaj	tum	meiñ	aik	doosre	ke	bhale	bure	
ka	kuchh	ikhtiyār	na	rakhe	gā	aur	ham	
farmāyeñ	ge	zālimoñ	se	us	āag	ka	'aƶāb	
chakho	jise	jhutlāte	the.

arabicText: وَإِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ ءَايَـٰتُنَا بَيِّنَـٰتٍۢ قَالُوا۟ مَا هَـٰذَآ إِلَّا رَجُلٌۭ يُرِيدُ أَن يَصُدَّكُمْ عَمَّا كَانَ يَعْبُدُ ءَابَآؤُكُمْ وَقَالُوا۟ مَا هَـٰذَآ إِلَّآ إِفْكٌۭ مُّفْتَرًۭى ۚ وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لِلْحَقِّ لَمَّا جَآءَهُمْ إِنْ هَـٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحْرٌۭ مُّبِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	Our	clear	verses	are	recited	to	
them,	they	say,	“He	is	nothing	but	a	man	
who	wishes	to	turn	you	away	from	the	
deities	of	your	forefathers!”;	and	they	say,	
“This	is	nothing	but	a	fabricated	lie”;	and	
said	the	disbelievers	regarding	the	truth	
when	it	reached	them,	“This	is	nothing	but	
obvious	magic.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	un	par	hamāri	roshan	āayateñ	
padhi	jāyeñ	to	kahte	haiñ	ye	to	nahiñ	
magar	aik	mard	ke	tumheñ	roknā	chāhte	
haiñ	tumhāre	bāp	dada	ke	m'aboodoñ	se	
aur	kahte	haiñ	ye	to	nahiñ	magar	bohtān	
juda	huā	aur	Kāfiroñ	ne	Haq	ko	kahā	jab	
un	ke	pās	āaya	yeh	to	nahiñ	magar	khulā	
jādu.

arabicText: وَمَآ ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُم مِّن كُتُبٍۢ يَدْرُسُونَهَا ۖ وَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَآ إِلَيْهِمْ قَبْلَكَ مِن نَّذِيرٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	did	not	give	them	any	Books	
which	they	may	read,	nor	did	We	send	to	
them	any	Herald	of	Warning	before	you.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ham	ne	unheiñ	kuchh	kitābeñ	na	diñ	
jinheñ	padhte	ho	na	tum	se	pahle	un	ke	
pās	koyi	dar	sunāne	wālā	āayā.

arabicText: وَكَذَّبَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ وَمَا بَلَغُوا۟ مِعْشَارَ مَآ ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُمْ فَكَذَّبُوا۟ رُسُلِى ۖ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ نَكِيرِ
englishTranslationText:
And	those	before	them	had	denied	-	and	
these	have	not	reached	even	a	tenth	of	
what	We	had	given	them	–	so	they	denied	
My	Noble	Messengers;	so	how	did	My	
rejection	turn	out?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	in	se	agloñ	ne	jhutlāyā	aur	ye	us	ke	
dasweñ	ko	bhi	na	pahuñche		jo	ham	ne	
unheñ	diyā	thā	phir	unhoñ	ne	mere	
Rasooloñ	ko	jhutlāyā	to	kaisā	huā	merā	
inkār	karnā.

arabicText: ۞ قُلْ إِنَّمَآ أَعِظُكُم بِوَٰحِدَةٍ ۖ أَن تَقُومُوا۟ لِلَّهِ مَثْنَىٰ وَفُرَٰدَىٰ ثُمَّ تَتَفَكَّرُوا۟ ۚ مَا بِصَاحِبِكُم مِّن جِنَّةٍ ۚ إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا نَذِيرٌۭ لَّكُم بَيْنَ يَدَىْ عَذَابٍۢ شَدِيدٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim,	“I	advise	you	just	one	thing;	that	
stand	up	for	Allah's	sake,	in	twos	and	
ones,	and	then	think”;	there	is	not	a	trace	of	insanity	in	this	companion	of	yours;	he	is	not	but	a	
Herald	of	Warning	for	you,	before	the	advent	of	a	severe	punishment!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāō	maiñ	tumhe	aik	hi	nasiḥat	
kartā	hoñ	ke	Allāh	ke	liye	khade	raho	do	do	aur	akele	akele	phir	soñcho	ke	tumhāre	un	saḥib	
meiñ	junoon	ki	koyi	bāt	nahiñ	woh	to	nahiñ	magar	tumheñ	dar	sunāne	wāle	aik	sakht	'aƶāb	ke	
āage.

arabicText: ۞ قُلْ إِنَّمَآ أَعِظُكُم بِوَٰحِدَةٍ ۖ أَن تَقُومُوا۟ لِلَّهِ مَثْنَىٰ وَفُرَٰدَىٰ ثُمَّ تَتَفَكَّرُوا۟ ۚ مَا بِصَاحِبِكُم مِّن جِنَّةٍ ۚ إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا نَذِيرٌۭ لَّكُم بَيْنَ يَدَىْ عَذَابٍۢ شَدِيدٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim,	“I	advise	you	just	one	thing;	that	
stand	up	for	Allah's	sake,	in	twos	and	
ones,	and	then	think”;	there	is	not	a	trace	of	insanity	in	this	companion	of	yours;	he	is	not	but	a	
Herald	of	Warning	for	you,	before	the	advent	of	a	severe	punishment!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāō	maiñ	tumhe	aik	hi	nasiḥat	
kartā	hoñ	ke	Allāh	ke	liye	khade	raho	do	do	aur	akele	akele	phir	soñcho	ke	tumhāre	un	saḥib	
meiñ	junoon	ki	koyi	bāt	nahiñ	woh	to	nahiñ	magar	tumheñ	dar	sunāne	wāle	aik	sakht	'aƶāb	ke	
āage.

arabicText: قُلْ مَا سَأَلْتُكُم مِّنْ أَجْرٍۢ فَهُوَ لَكُمْ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ۖ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ شَهِيدٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Say,	“Whatever	fee	I	might	have	asked	from	you	upon	this,	is	yours;	my	reward	is	only	upon	
Allah;	and	He	is	Witness	over	all	things.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāō	meiñ	ne	tum	se	is	par	kuchh	ajr	māñga	ho	to	woh	tumhiñ	ko	merā	ajr	to	Allāh	hi	
par	hai	aur	woh	har	chiz	par	gawāh	hai.

arabicText: قُلْ إِنَّ رَبِّى يَقْذِفُ بِٱلْحَقِّ عَلَّـٰمُ ٱلْغُيُوبِ
englishTranslationText: Proclaim,	“Indeed	my	Lord	sends	down	the	truth;	the	All	Knowing	of	all	the	hidden.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Tum	farmāō	be-shak	merā	Rab	ḥaq	ka	ilqā	farmātā	hai	bahut	jānne	wālā	sab	ghaiboñ	ka.

arabicText: قُلْ جَآءَ ٱلْحَقُّ وَمَا يُبْدِئُ ٱلْبَـٰطِلُ وَمَا يُعِيدُ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim,	“The	truth	has	come,	and	
falsehood	dare	not	commence	nor	return.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāō	ḥaq	āayā	aur	bāṭil	na	pahel	
kare	aur	na	phir	(laut)	kar	āaye.

arabicText: قُلْ إِن ضَلَلْتُ فَإِنَّمَآ أَضِلُّ عَلَىٰ نَفْسِى ۖ وَإِنِ ٱهْتَدَيْتُ فَبِمَا يُوحِىٓ إِلَىَّ رَبِّىٓ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ سَمِيعٌۭ قَرِيبٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim,	“If	I	stray,	I	stray	only	for	my	
own	harm;	and	if	I	attain	guidance,	it	is	
because	of	what	my	Lord	has	sent	down	
to	me;	indeed	He	is	All	Hearing,	Close.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāō	agar	maiñ	bahkā	to	apne	hi	
bure	ko	bahkā	aur	agar	meiñ	ne	rāh	pāyi	
to	us	ke	sabab	jo	merā	Rab	meri	ṭaraf	
waḥi	farmātā	hai	be-shak	woh	sunne	wālā	
nazdeek	hai.

arabicText: وَلَوْ تَرَىٰٓ إِذْ فَزِعُوا۟ فَلَا فَوْتَ وَأُخِذُوا۟ مِن مَّكَانٍۢ قَرِيبٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	only	you	see,	when	they	will	be	
forced	into	a	terror	from	which	they	will	
be	unable	to	escape,	and	are	seized	from	a	
place	nearby.	(Wherever	they	go,	they	are	
never	far).
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kisi	ṭaraḥ	to	dekhe	jab	woh	ghabrāhat	
meiñ	dāle	jāyeñ	ge	phir	bach	kar	na	nikal	
sakeñ	ge	aur	aik	qarib	jagah	se	pakad	liye	
jāyeñ	ge

arabicText: وَقَالُوٓا۟ ءَامَنَّا بِهِۦ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُمُ ٱلتَّنَاوُشُ مِن مَّكَانٍۭ بَعِيدٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	will	say,	“We	accept	faith	in	it”;	
and	how	can	they	attain	it	from	so	far	
away?	(After they have crossed the limit 
of life allotted to them.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kaheñ	ge	ham	is	par	imān	lāye	aur	ab	
woh	isey	kiyuñ	kar	pāyeñ	itni	door	jagah	
se.

arabicText: وَقَدْ كَفَرُوا۟ بِهِۦ مِن قَبْلُ ۖ وَيَقْذِفُونَ بِٱلْغَيْبِ مِن مَّكَانٍۭ بَعِيدٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
For	they	had	disbelieved	in	it	before;	and	
they	hurl	allegations	without	seeing,	from	
far	away.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ki	pahle	to	us	se	kufr	kar	chuke	the	aur	be	
dekhe	pheñk	mārte	haiñ	door	makān	se.

arabicText: وَحِيلَ بَيْنَهُمْ وَبَيْنَ مَا يَشْتَهُونَ كَمَا فُعِلَ بِأَشْيَاعِهِم مِّن قَبْلُ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ فِى شَكٍّۢ مُّرِيبٍۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	a	barrier	is	set	between	them	and	
what	they	desire	*,	as	was	done	for	their	
earlier	groups;	indeed	they	are	in	a	doubt	
that	deceives.	(To accept faith or return 
to earth)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	rok	kar	di	gayi	un	meiñ	aur	us	meiñ	
jise	chāhte	haiñ	jaise	un	ke	phahle	girohoñ	
se	kiyā	gayā	thā	be-shak	woh	dhokā	dālne	
wāle	shak	meiñ	the.

arabicText: ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ فَاطِرِ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ جَاعِلِ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ رُسُلًا أُو۟لِىٓ أَجْنِحَةٍۢ مَّثْنَىٰ وَثُلَـٰثَ وَرُبَـٰعَ ۚ يَزِيدُ فِى ٱلْخَلْقِ مَا يَشَآءُ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ قَدِيرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
All	praise	is	to	Allah,	the	Maker	of	the	heavens	and	the	earth,	Who	assigns	angels	as	
messengers	–	who	have	pairs	of	two,	three,	four	wings;	He	increases	in	creation	whatever	He	
wills;	indeed	Allah	is	Able	to	do	all	things.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Sab	khoobiyāñ	Allāh	ko	jo	āasmānoñ	aur	zameen	ka	banane	wālā	Farishtoñ	ko	Rasool	karne	
wālā	jin	ke	do	do	tin	tin	chār	chār	par	haiñ	badhātā	hai	āafrinish	(paidāish)	meiñ	jo	chāhe	be
shak	Allāh	har	chiz	par	qādir	hai.

arabicText: مَّا يَفْتَحِ ٱللَّهُ لِلنَّاسِ مِن رَّحْمَةٍۢ فَلَا مُمْسِكَ لَهَا ۖ وَمَا يُمْسِكْ فَلَا مُرْسِلَ لَهُۥ مِنۢ بَعْدِهِۦ ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
No	one	can	withhold	the	mercy	which	Allah	opens	to	mankind;	and	whatever	He	withholds	–	so	
after	it,	none	can	release	it;	and	only	He	is	the	Most	Honourable,	the	Wise.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allāh	jo	raḥmat	logoñ	ke	liye	khole	us	ka	koyi	rokne	wālā	nahiñ	aur	jo	kuchh	rok	le	to	us	ki	rok	
ke	b'ad	us	ka	koi	chodne	wālā	nahiñ	aur	wohi	'izzat	o	ḥikmat	wālā	hai.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ ٱذْكُرُوا۟ نِعْمَتَ ٱللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ ۚ هَلْ مِنْ خَـٰلِقٍ غَيْرُ ٱللَّهِ يَرْزُقُكُم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ فَأَنَّىٰ تُؤْفَكُونَ
englishTranslationText:
O	people!	Remember	the	favour	of	Allah	upon	you;	is	there	a	Creator	other	than	Allah	who	can	
provide	you	sustenance	from	the	sky	and	the	earth?	There	is	no	God	except	Him;	so	where	are	
you	reverting?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	logoñ!	Apne	ūpar	Allāh	ka	eḥsān	yād	karo	kyā	Allāh	ke	siwā	aur	bhi	koi	khāliq	ke	āasmān	
aur	zameen		se	tumheñ	rozi	de	us	ke	siwā	koi	ma'abod	nahiñ	to	tum	kahāñ	auñdhe	jāte	ho.

arabicText: وَإِن يُكَذِّبُوكَ فَقَدْ كُذِّبَتْ رُسُلٌۭ مِّن قَبْلِكَ ۚ وَإِلَى ٱللَّهِ تُرْجَعُ ٱلْأُمُورُ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	they	deny	you,	many	Noble	
Messengers	were	denied	before	you;	and	
towards	Allah	only	is	the	return	of	all	
matters.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	ye	tumheñ	jhutlāyeñ	to	be-shak	
tum	se	pahle	kitne	hi	Rasool	jhutlāye	gaye	
aur	sab	kām	Allāh	hi	ki	ṭaraf	phirte	haiñ.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ إِنَّ وَعْدَ ٱللَّهِ حَقٌّۭ ۖ فَلَا تَغُرَّنَّكُمُ ٱلْحَيَوٰةُ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ وَلَا يَغُرَّنَّكُم بِٱللَّهِ ٱلْغَرُورُ
englishTranslationText:
O	people!	Allah’s	promise	is	indeed	true;	
therefore	do	not	ever	let	the	worldly	life	
deceive	you;	nor	ever	let	the	great	cheat	
deceive	you	in	respect	of	Allah’s	
commands.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	logoñ!	Be-shak	Allāh	ka	w'ada	sach	
hai	to	hargiz	tumheñ	dhokā	na	de	dunyā	
ki	zindagi	aur	hargiz	tumheñ	Allāh	ke	ḥilm	
par	fareb	na	de	woh	badā	farebi.

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنَ لَكُمْ عَدُوٌّۭ فَٱتَّخِذُوهُ عَدُوًّا ۚ إِنَّمَا يَدْعُوا۟ حِزْبَهُۥ لِيَكُونُوا۟ مِنْ أَصْحَـٰبِ ٱلسَّعِيرِ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	Satan	is	your	enemy,	therefore	you	
too	take	him	as	an	enemy;	he	only	calls	his	
group	so	that	they	become	the	people	of	
hell!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	shaiṭān	tumhārā	dushman	hai	to	
tum	bhi	usey	dushman	samjho	woh	to	
apne	giroh	ko	isi	liye	bulātā	hai	ke	
dozakhiyoñ	meiñ	hoñ.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌۭ شَدِيدٌۭ ۖ وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ لَهُم مَّغْفِرَةٌۭ وَأَجْرٌۭ كَبِيرٌ
englishTranslationText:
For	the	disbelievers	is	a	severe	
punishment;	and	for	those	who	accepted	
faith	and	did	good	deeds	is	forgiveness,	
and	an	immense	reward.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kāfiroñ	ke	liye	sakht	'aƶāb	hai	aur	jo	imān	
lāye	aur	achche	kām	kiye	un	ke	liye	
bakhshish	aur	badā	sawāb	hai.

arabicText: أَفَمَن زُيِّنَ لَهُۥ سُوٓءُ عَمَلِهِۦ فَرَءَاهُ حَسَنًۭا ۖ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُضِلُّ مَن يَشَآءُ وَيَهْدِى مَن يَشَآءُ ۖ فَلَا تَذْهَبْ نَفْسُكَ عَلَيْهِمْ حَسَرَٰتٍ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلِيمٌۢ بِمَا يَصْنَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	will	one	whose	misdeeds	are	made	
seeming	good	to	him	-	so	he	deems	them	
good	-	be	ever	equal	to	the	one	who	is	
upon	guidance?	Therefore	indeed	Allah	
sends	astray	whomever	He	wills,	and	
guides	whomever	He	wills;	so	may	not	
your	life	be	lost	in	despairing	after	them;	
Allah	knows	their	deeds	very	well.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	kyā	woh	jis	ki	nigāh	meiñ	us	ka	burā	
kam	āarāsta	kiyā	gayā	ke	us	ne	use	bhalā	
samjhā	hidāyat	wāle	ki	ṭaraḥ	ho	jāye	gā	is	
liye	Allāh	gumrāh	kartā	hai	jise	chāhe	aur	
rāh	detā	hai	jise	chāhe	to	tumhāri	jān	un	
par	ḥasratoñ	meiñ	na	jāye	Allāh	khoob	
jānta	hai	jo	kuchh	woh	karte	haiñ.

arabicText: وَٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَرْسَلَ ٱلرِّيَـٰحَ فَتُثِيرُ سَحَابًۭا فَسُقْنَـٰهُ إِلَىٰ بَلَدٍۢ مَّيِّتٍۢ فَأَحْيَيْنَا بِهِ ٱلْأَرْضَ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهَا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ ٱلنُّشُورُ
englishTranslationText:
And	it	is	Allah	Who	sent	the	winds	-	so	
they	raise	clouds	and	We	then	direct	it	
towards	a	dead	city	–	so	with	it	We	revive	
the	earth	after	its	death;	and	this	is	how	
the	resurrection	will	be.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Allāh	hai	jis	ne	bhejiñ	hawāyeñ	ke	
bādal	ubhārti	haiñ	phir	ham	usey	kiśi	
murda	shahar	ki	ṭaraf	rawāñ	karte	haiñ	to	
us	ke	sabab	ham	zameen	ko	zinda	farmāte	
haiñ	us	ke	mare	peeche	yuñhi	ḥashr	meiñ	
uthnā	hai.

arabicText: مَن كَانَ يُرِيدُ ٱلْعِزَّةَ فَلِلَّهِ ٱلْعِزَّةُ جَمِيعًا ۚ إِلَيْهِ يَصْعَدُ ٱلْكَلِمُ ٱلطَّيِّبُ وَٱلْعَمَلُ ٱلصَّـٰلِحُ يَرْفَعُهُۥ ۚ وَٱلَّذِينَ يَمْكُرُونَ ٱلسَّيِّـَٔاتِ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌۭ شَدِيدٌۭ ۖ وَمَكْرُ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُوَ يَبُورُ
englishTranslationText:
Whoever	desires	honour	–	therefore	all	honour	belongs	to	Allah!	*	Towards	Him	only	ascends	
the	pure	good	speech,	and	He	raises	high	the	pious	deed;	and	for	those	who	conspire	evil	is	a	
severe	punishment;	and	their	own	conspiracy	will	be	destroyed.	(It	is	Allah	Who	bestows	
honour,	to	whomever	He	wills.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jise	'izzat	ki	chāh	ho	to	'izzat	to	sab	Allāh	
ke	hāth	hai	usi	ki	ṭaraf	chadhtā	hai	
pākeeza	kalām	aur	jo	nek	kām	hai	woh	
usey	buland	kartā	hai	aur	woh	jo	bure	dāōñ	(fareb)	karte	haiñ	un	ke	liye	sakht	'aƶāb	hai	aur	
unhiñ	ka	makr	barbād	hogā.

arabicText: وَٱللَّهُ خَلَقَكُم مِّن تُرَابٍۢ ثُمَّ مِن نُّطْفَةٍۢ ثُمَّ جَعَلَكُمْ أَزْوَٰجًۭا ۚ وَمَا تَحْمِلُ مِنْ أُنثَىٰ وَلَا تَضَعُ إِلَّا بِعِلْمِهِۦ ۚ وَمَا يُعَمَّرُ مِن مُّعَمَّرٍۢ وَلَا يُنقَصُ مِنْ عُمُرِهِۦٓ إِلَّا فِى كِتَـٰبٍ ۚ إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ يَسِيرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	Allah	created	you	from	clay,	then	a	drop	of	liquid,	then	made	you	as	couples;	and	no	female	
conceives	or	gives	birth	except	with	His	knowledge;	and	every	aged	being	that	is	given	the	age,	
and	every	one	whose	life	is	kept	short	–	all	this	is	in	a	Book;	indeed	this	is	easy	for	Allah.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Allāh	ne	tumheñ	banāyā	mitti	se	phir	pāni	ki	booñd	se	phir	tumheñ	kiyā	jode	jode	aur	kisi	
mādah	ko	pet	nahiñ	rahtā	aur	na	woh	janti	hai	magar	us	ke	'ilm	se	aur	jis	badi	'umr	wāle	ko	
'umr	di	jāye	yā	jis	kisi	ki	'umr	kam	rakhi	jāye	ye	sab	aik	kitāb	meiñ	hai	be-shak	ye	Allāh	ko	
āasān	hai.

arabicText: وَمَا يَسْتَوِى ٱلْبَحْرَانِ هَـٰذَا عَذْبٌۭ فُرَاتٌۭ سَآئِغٌۭ شَرَابُهُۥ وَهَـٰذَا مِلْحٌ أُجَاجٌۭ ۖ وَمِن كُلٍّۢ تَأْكُلُونَ لَحْمًۭا طَرِيًّۭا وَتَسْتَخْرِجُونَ حِلْيَةًۭ تَلْبَسُونَهَا ۖ وَتَرَى ٱلْفُلْكَ فِيهِ مَوَاخِرَ لِتَبْتَغُوا۟ مِن فَضْلِهِۦ وَلَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	two	seas	are	not	alike;	this	is	
sweet,	very	sweet	and	palatable	–	and	this	
is	salty,	bitter;	and	from	each	you	eat	
fresh	meat	and	extract	the	ornament	
which	you	wear;	and	you	see	the	ship	
cleaving	through	it,	so	that	you	may	seek	
His	munificence,	and	in	some	way	become	
grateful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	donoñ	samundar	aik	se	nahiñ	ye	
mithā	hai	khoob	meethā	pāni	khush
gawār	aur	ye	khāri	hai	talkh	aur	har	aik	
meiñ	se	tum	khāte	ho	tāza	gosht	aur	
nikālte	ho	pehan	ne	ka	aik	gahnā	aur	tu	
kashtiyoñ	ko	us	meiñ	dekhe	ke	pāni	
cheerti	haiñ	take	tum	us	ka	fazl	talāsh	
karo	aur	kisi	ṭaraḥ	ḥaq	māno.

arabicText: يُولِجُ ٱلَّيْلَ فِى ٱلنَّهَارِ وَيُولِجُ ٱلنَّهَارَ فِى ٱلَّيْلِ وَسَخَّرَ ٱلشَّمْسَ وَٱلْقَمَرَ كُلٌّۭ يَجْرِى لِأَجَلٍۢ مُّسَمًّۭى ۚ ذَٰلِكُمُ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّكُمْ لَهُ ٱلْمُلْكُ ۚ وَٱلَّذِينَ تَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِهِۦ مَا يَمْلِكُونَ مِن قِطْمِيرٍ
englishTranslationText:
He	brings	the	night	in	a	part	of	the	day	
and	He	brings	the	day	in	a	part	of	the	
night;	and	He	has	subjected	the	sun	and	
moon;	each	one	runs	to	its	fixed	term;	
such	is	Allah,	your	Lord	–	only	His	is	the	
kingship;	and	those	whom	you	worship	
instead	of	Him	do	not	own	even	the	husk	
of	a	date-seed.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Rāt	lātā	hai	Din	ke	ḥisse	meiñ	aur	Din	lātā	
hai	Rāt	ke	ḥisse	meiñ	aur	us	ne	kām	meiñ	
lagāye	Sooraj	aur	Chāñd	har	aik	aik	
muqarrar	mi'āad	chaltā	hai	ye	hai	Allāh	
tumhārā	Rab	usi	ki	bādshāhi	hai	aur	us	ke	
siwā	jinheñ	tum	poojte	ho	dāna-e-khurmā	
ke	chilke	tak	ke	mālik	nahiñ.

arabicText: إِن تَدْعُوهُمْ لَا يَسْمَعُوا۟ دُعَآءَكُمْ وَلَوْ سَمِعُوا۟ مَا ٱسْتَجَابُوا۟ لَكُمْ ۖ وَيَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ يَكْفُرُونَ بِشِرْكِكُمْ ۚ وَلَا يُنَبِّئُكَ مِثْلُ خَبِيرٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
If	you	call	them,	they	do	not	hear	your	
call;	and	supposedly	if	they	heard	it,	they	
cannot	fulfil	your	needs;	and	on	the	Day	of	
Resurrection	they	will	deny	your	ascribed	
partnership;	and	none	will	inform	you	like	
Him	Who	informs.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	unheñ	pukāro	to	wo	tumhāri	pukār	
na	suneñ	aur	bilfarz	sun	bhi	leñ	to	
tumhāri	ḥājat	rawā	na	kar	sakeñ	aur	
Qiyāmat	ke	din	woh	tumhāre	shirk	se	
munkir	hoñ	ge	aur	tujhe	koyi	na	batāye	gā	
us	batāne	wāle	ki	ṭaraḥ.

arabicText: ۞ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ أَنتُمُ ٱلْفُقَرَآءُ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ ۖ وَٱللَّهُ هُوَ ٱلْغَنِىُّ ٱلْحَمِيدُ
englishTranslationText:
O	people!	You	are	dependent	on	Allah;	
and	Allah	only	is	the	Independent	
(Absolute,	Not	Needing	Anything),	the	
Most	Praiseworthy.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	logoñ!	Tum	sab	Allāh	ke	muḥtāj	aur	
Allāh	hi	be-niyāz	hai	sab	khoobiyoñ	
sarāhā.

arabicText: إِن يَشَأْ يُذْهِبْكُمْ وَيَأْتِ بِخَلْقٍۢ جَدِيدٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
If	He	wills,	He	can	take	you	away	and	
bring	other	creatures.
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	chāhe	to	tumheñ	le	jāye	aur	nayi	makhlooq	le	āaye.

arabicText: وَمَا ذَٰلِكَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ بِعَزِيزٍۢ
englishTranslationText: And	this	not	at	all	difficult	for	Allah.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	ye	Allāh	par	kuch	dushwār	nahiñ.

arabicText: وَلَا تَزِرُ وَازِرَةٌۭ وِزْرَ أُخْرَىٰ ۚ وَإِن تَدْعُ مُثْقَلَةٌ إِلَىٰ حِمْلِهَا لَا يُحْمَلْ مِنْهُ شَىْءٌۭ وَلَوْ كَانَ ذَا قُرْبَىٰٓ ۗ إِنَّمَا تُنذِرُ ٱلَّذِينَ يَخْشَوْنَ رَبَّهُم بِٱلْغَيْبِ وَأَقَامُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ ۚ وَمَن تَزَكَّىٰ فَإِنَّمَا يَتَزَكَّىٰ لِنَفْسِهِۦ ۚ وَإِلَى ٱللَّهِ ٱلْمَصِيرُ
englishTranslationText:
And	no	burdened	soul	will	carry	another	soul’s	burden;	and	if	a	burdened	soul	calls	another	to	
share	the	burden,	no	one	will	carry	any	part	of	it,	even	if	he	is	a	close	relative;	O	dear	Prophet	
(Muhammad	–	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	your	warning	only	benefits	those	who	fear	
their	Lord	without	seeing	and	who	keep	the	prayer	established;	and	whoever	cleansed	himself,	
has	cleansed	for	his	own	benefit;	and	towards	Allah	only	is	the	return.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	koyi	bojh	uthāne	wāli	jān	doosri	ka	bojh	na	uthāye	gi	aur	agar	koyi	bojh	wāli	apnā	bojh	
batāne	ko	kisi	ko	bulāye	to	us	ke	bojh	meiñ	se	koyi	kuchh	na	uthāye	gā	agar	che	qareeb	
rishtedār	ho	aey	Meḥboob	tumhārā	dar	sunānā	to	unheñ	ko	kām	detā	hai	jo	be	dekhe	apne	Rab	
se	darte	aur	Namāz	qāim	rakhte	haiñ	aur	jo	suthrā	huā	to	apne	hi	bhale	ko	suthrā	huā	aur	Allāh	
hi	ki	ṭaraf	phirnā	hai.

arabicText: وَمَا يَسْتَوِى ٱلْأَعْمَىٰ وَٱلْبَصِيرُ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	blind	and	the	sighted	are	not	
equal!
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	barābar	nahiñ	andhā	aur	ankhiyārā.

arabicText: وَلَا ٱلظُّلُمَـٰتُ وَلَا ٱلنُّورُ
englishTranslationText: And	neither	are	darkness	and	brightness!
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	na	andheriyāñ	aur	ujālā.

arabicText: وَلَا ٱلظِّلُّ وَلَا ٱلْحَرُورُ
englishTranslationText:
And	neither	are	the	shadow	and	the	hot	
sunshine!
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	na	sāya	aur	na	tez	dhoop.

arabicText: وَمَا يَسْتَوِى ٱلْأَحْيَآءُ وَلَا ٱلْأَمْوَٰتُ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُسْمِعُ مَن يَشَآءُ ۖ وَمَآ أَنتَ بِمُسْمِعٍۢ مَّن فِى ٱلْقُبُورِ
englishTranslationText:
And	not	equal	are	the	living	and	the	dead!	
Indeed	Allah	causes	them	to	listen	*,	
whomever	He	wills;	and	you	cannot	make	
those	who	are	in	the	graves	**	listen.	(* 
Listen to guidance **The disbelievers are 
referred to as dead, whose fates are 
sealed.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	barābar	nahiñ	zinde	aur	murde	be
shak	Allāh	sunāta	hai	jise	chāhe	aur	tum	
nahiñ	sunāne	wāle	unheñ	jo	qabroñ	meiñ	
pade	haiñ.

arabicText: إِنْ أَنتَ إِلَّا نَذِيرٌ
englishTranslationText: You	are	purely	a	Herald	of	Warning.
romanUrduTranslationText: Tum	to	yahi	dar	sunāne	wāle	ho.

arabicText: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَـٰكَ بِٱلْحَقِّ بَشِيرًۭا وَنَذِيرًۭا ۚ وَإِن مِّنْ أُمَّةٍ إِلَّا خَلَا فِيهَا نَذِيرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	O	dear	Prophet	(Muhammad	–	peace	
and	blessings	be	upon	him),	We	have	
indeed	sent	you	with	the	Truth,	giving	
glad	tidings	and	heralding	warnings;	and	
there	was	a	Herald	of	Warning	in	every	
group.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Meḥboob	be-shak	ham	ne	tumheñ	ḥaq	
ke	sāth	bhejā	khushkhabri	detā	aur	dar	
sunata	aur	jo	koyi	giroh	thā	sab	meiñ	aik	
dar	sunāne	wālā	guzar	chuka.

arabicText: وَإِن يُكَذِّبُوكَ فَقَدْ كَذَّبَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ جَآءَتْهُمْ رُسُلُهُم بِٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ وَبِٱلزُّبُرِ وَبِٱلْكِتَـٰبِ ٱلْمُنِيرِ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	these	disbelievers	deny	you,	those	
before	them	had	also	denied;	their	Noble	
Messengers	came	to	them	with	clear	proofs	
and	scriptures	and	the	bright	Book.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	ye	tumheñ	jhutlāyeñ	to	un	se	agle	
bhi	jhutlā	chuke	haiñ	un	ke	pās	un	ke	
Rasool	āaye	roushan	dalileñ	aur	saḥife	aur	
chamakti	kitāb	le	kar.

arabicText: ثُمَّ أَخَذْتُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ ۖ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ نَكِيرِ
englishTranslationText:
Then	I	seized	the	disbelievers;	so	how	did	
My	rejection	turn	out?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	maiñ	ne	kāfiroñ	ko	pakdā	to	kaisā	huā	
merā	inkār.

arabicText: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ أَنزَلَ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءًۭ فَأَخْرَجْنَا بِهِۦ ثَمَرَٰتٍۢ مُّخْتَلِفًا أَلْوَٰنُهَا ۚ وَمِنَ ٱلْجِبَالِ جُدَدٌۢ بِيضٌۭ وَحُمْرٌۭ مُّخْتَلِفٌ أَلْوَٰنُهَا وَغَرَابِيبُ سُودٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Have	you	not	seen	that	it	is	Allah	Who	
causes	the	water	to	descend	from	the	sky?	
So	with	it	We	have	grown	various	colourful	fruits;	and	among	the	mountains	are	tracks	white	
and	red,	of	different	hues,	and	others	dark	black.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	to	ne	na	dekhā	ke	Allāh	ne	āasmān	se	
pāni	utārā	to	ham	ne	us	se	phal	nikāle	rang	
birang	aur	pahādoñ	meiñ	rāste	haiñ	safed	
aur	surkh	rang-rang	ke	aur	kuchh	kāle	
bhojang	(siyāh	kāle).

arabicText: وَمِنَ ٱلنَّاسِ وَٱلدَّوَآبِّ وَٱلْأَنْعَـٰمِ مُخْتَلِفٌ أَلْوَٰنُهُۥ كَذَٰلِكَ ۗ إِنَّمَا يَخْشَى ٱللَّهَ مِنْ عِبَادِهِ ٱلْعُلَمَـٰٓؤُا۟ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَزِيزٌ غَفُورٌ
englishTranslationText:
And	similarly	the	colours	of	men	and	beasts	and	cattle,	are	different;	among	the	bondmen	of	
Allah,	only	the	people	of	knowledge	fear	Him;	indeed	Allah	is	the	Most	Honourable,	Oft	
Forgiving.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	āadmiyoñ	aur	jānwaroñ	aur	chārpāyoñ	ke	rang	yuñhi	ṭaraḥ	ṭaraḥ	ke	haiñ	Allāh	se	us	ke	
bandoñ	meiñ	wohi	darte	haiñ	jo	'Ilm	wāle	haiñ	be-shak	Allāh	'izzat	wālā	bakhshne	wālā.

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَتْلُونَ كِتَـٰبَ ٱللَّهِ وَأَقَامُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَأَنفَقُوا۟ مِمَّا رَزَقْنَـٰهُمْ سِرًّۭا وَعَلَانِيَةًۭ يَرْجُونَ تِجَـٰرَةًۭ لَّن تَبُورَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	those	who	read	the	Book	of	Allah,	and	keep	the	prayer	established,	and	spend	from	
what	We	have	bestowed	upon	them	in	secret	and	publicly,	are	hopeful	of	a	trade	in	which	there	
is	never	a	loss.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	woh	jo	Allāh	ki	kitāb	padhte	haiñ	aur	Namāz	qāim	rakhte	aur	hamāre	diye	se	kuchh	
hamāri	rāh	meiñ	kharch	karte	haiñ	poshida	aur	zāhir	woh	aisi	tijārat	ke	ummid	wār	haiñ	jis	meiñ	
hargiz	totā	(nuqsān)	nahiñ.

arabicText: لِيُوَفِّيَهُمْ أُجُورَهُمْ وَيَزِيدَهُم مِّن فَضْلِهِۦٓ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ غَفُورٌۭ شَكُورٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
In	order	that	He	may	reward	them	with	goodness	in	full,	and	further	increase	it	with	His	
munificence;	indeed	He	is	Oft	Forgiving,	Most	Appreciative.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tākay	un	ke	sawāb	unheñ	bhar	poor	de	aur	apne	fazl	se	aur	ziyāda	'aṭā	kare	be-shak	woh	
bakhshne	wālā	qadr	farmāne	wālā	hai.

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِىٓ أَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَيْكَ مِنَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ هُوَ ٱلْحَقُّ مُصَدِّقًۭا لِّمَا بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِعِبَادِهِۦ لَخَبِيرٌۢ بَصِيرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	Book	which	We	have	divinely	
revealed	to	you	–	that	is	the	Truth,	
confirming	the	Books	which	were	before	
it;	indeed	Allah	is	Aware	of	His	bondmen,	
All	Seeing.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	Kitāb	jo	ham	ne	tumhāri	ṭaraf	
woḥi	bheji	wohi	ḥaq	hai	apne	se	agli	
kitāboñ	ki	tasdeeq	farmāti	huyi	be-shak	
Allāh	apne	bandoñ	se	khabardār	dekhne	
wālā	hai.

arabicText: ثُمَّ أَوْرَثْنَا ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱصْطَفَيْنَا مِنْ عِبَادِنَا ۖ فَمِنْهُمْ ظَالِمٌۭ لِّنَفْسِهِۦ وَمِنْهُم مُّقْتَصِدٌۭ وَمِنْهُمْ سَابِقٌۢ بِٱلْخَيْرَٰتِ بِإِذْنِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ ٱلْفَضْلُ ٱلْكَبِيرُ
englishTranslationText:
We	then	made	Our	chosen	bondmen	the	
inheritors	of	the	Book;	so	among	them	is	
one	who	wrongs	himself;	and	among	them	
is	one	who	stays	on	the	middle	course;	
and	among	them	is	one	who,	by	the	
command	of	Allah,	surpassed	others	in	
good	deeds;	this	is	the	great	favour!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	Ham	ne	Kitāb	ka	wāris	kiyā	apne	
chune	huye	bandoñ	ko	to	un	meiñ	koyi	
apni	jān	par	zulm	kartā	hai	aur	un	meiñ	
koyi	miyāna	chāl	par	hai	aur	un	meiñ	koyi	
woh	hai	jo	Allāh	ke	ḥukm	se	bhlāiyoñ	
meiñ	sabqat	le	gayā	yahi	badā	fazl	hai.

arabicText: جَنَّـٰتُ عَدْنٍۢ يَدْخُلُونَهَا يُحَلَّوْنَ فِيهَا مِنْ أَسَاوِرَ مِن ذَهَبٍۢ وَلُؤْلُؤًۭا ۖ وَلِبَاسُهُمْ فِيهَا حَرِيرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
They	shall	enter	the	Gardens	of	
everlasting	stay	(Eden)	–	in	which	they	
shall	be	given	to	adorn	armlets	of	gold	
and	pearls;	and	their	garment	in	it	is	silk.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Basne	ke	bāghoñ	meiñ	dākhil	hoñ	ge	woh	
un	meiñ	sone	ke	kangan	aur	moti	pahnāye	
jāyeñ	ge	aur	wahāñ	un	ki	poshāk	reshmi	
hai.

arabicText: وَقَالُوا۟ ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَذْهَبَ عَنَّا ٱلْحَزَنَ ۖ إِنَّ رَبَّنَا لَغَفُورٌۭ شَكُورٌ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	will	say;	“All	praise	is	to	Allah	
Who	has	put	away	our	grief;	indeed	Our	
Lord	is	Oft	Forgiving,	Most	Appreciative.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kaheñ	ge	sab	khoobiyāñ	Allāh	ko	jis	
ne	hamārā	gham	door	kiyā	be-shak	
hamārā	Rab	bakhshne	wālā	qadr	farmāne	
wālā	hai.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِىٓ أَحَلَّنَا دَارَ ٱلْمُقَامَةِ مِن فَضْلِهِۦ لَا يَمَسُّنَا فِيهَا نَصَبٌۭ وَلَا يَمَسُّنَا فِيهَا لُغُوبٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
“The	One	Who	has,	by	His	munificence,	
established	us	in	a	place	of	serenity;	in	
which	no	hardship	shall	ever	reach	us	nor	
any	fatigue	affect	us.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	jis	ne	hameñ	āarām	ki	jagah	utārā	
apne	fazl	se	hameñ	us	meiñ	na	koyi	
takleef	pahuñche	na	hameñ	us	meiñ	koyi	
takān	lāḥiq	ho.

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَهُمْ نَارُ جَهَنَّمَ لَا يُقْضَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ فَيَمُوتُوا۟ وَلَا يُخَفَّفُ عَنْهُم مِّنْ عَذَابِهَا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى كُلَّ كَفُورٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	for	those	who	disbelieved	is	the	fire	
of	hell;	neither	does	their	final	seizure	
come	that	they	may	die,	nor	is	its	
punishment	lightened	for	them;	this	is	
how	We	punish	every	extremely	ungrateful	person.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jinhoñ	ne	kufr	kiyā	un	ke	liye	Jahannam	ki	āag	hai	na	un	ki	qazā	āaye	ke	mar	jāyeñ	aur	na	
un	par	us	ka	'aƶāb	kuchh	halkā	kiyā	jāye	ham	aisi	hi	sazā	dete	haiñ	har	bade	nā-shukre	ko.

arabicText: وَهُمْ يَصْطَرِخُونَ فِيهَا رَبَّنَآ أَخْرِجْنَا نَعْمَلْ صَـٰلِحًا غَيْرَ ٱلَّذِى كُنَّا نَعْمَلُ ۚ أَوَلَمْ نُعَمِّرْكُم مَّا يَتَذَكَّرُ فِيهِ مَن تَذَكَّرَ وَجَآءَكُمُ ٱلنَّذِيرُ ۖ فَذُوقُوا۟ فَمَا لِلظَّـٰلِمِينَ مِن نَّصِيرٍ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	shall	be	screaming	in	it;	“Our	Lord!	Extricate	us,	so	that	we	may	do	good	deeds,	the	
opposite	of	what	we	used	to	do”;	(It	will	be	said	to	them)	“And	did	We	not	give	you	an	age	long	
enough,	in	which	anyone	who	wants	to	understand	would	have	understood?	And	the	Herald	of	
Warning	did	come	to	you;	therefore	now	taste	it	–	for	the	unjust	do	not	have	any	supporter.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	us	meiñ	chillāte	hoñge	aey	hamāre	Rab	hameñ	nikāl	ke	ham	achchā	kām	kareñ	us	ke	
khilāf	jo	pahle	karte	the	aur	kyā	ham	ne	tumheñ	woh	'umr	na	di	thi	jis	meiñ	samajh	letā	jise	
samajhnā	hotā	aur	dar	sunāne	wālā	tumhāre	pās	tashrif	lāyā	thā	to	ab	chakho	ke	zālimoñ	ka	
koyi	madad-gār	nahiñ.

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَـٰلِمُ غَيْبِ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ عَلِيمٌۢ بِذَاتِ ٱلصُّدُورِ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	Allah	is	All	Knowing	–	of	all	the	hidden	things	in	the	heavens	and	in	the	earth;	indeed	He	
knows	what	lies	within	the	hearts.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	Allāh	jān	ne	wālā	hai	āasmānoñ	aur	zameen	ki	har	chupi	bāt	ka	be-shak	woh	diloñ	ki	
bāt	jānta	hai.

arabicText: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَكُمْ خَلَـٰٓئِفَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ فَمَن كَفَرَ فَعَلَيْهِ كُفْرُهُۥ ۖ وَلَا يَزِيدُ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ كُفْرُهُمْ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ إِلَّا مَقْتًۭا ۖ وَلَا يَزِيدُ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ كُفْرُهُمْ إِلَّا خَسَارًۭا
englishTranslationText:
It	is	He	Who	has	made	you	the	successors	
of	your	predecessors	in	the	earth;	so	
whoever	disbelieves	–	(the	harm	of)	his	
disbelief	falls	only	on	him;	and	for	the	
disbelievers,	their	disbelief	increases	
nothing	in	their	Lord’s	sight	except	
disgust;	and	for	the	disbelievers,	their	
disbelief	increases	nothing	for	them	
except	ruin.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Wahi	hai	jis	ne	tumheñ	zameen	meiñ	
agloñ	ka	jānashin	kiyā	to	jo	kufr	kare	us	
ka	kufr	usi	par	pade	aur	kāfiroñ	ko	un	ka	
kufr	un	ke	Rab	ke	yahāñ	nahiñ	badhāye	gā	
magar	bezāri	aur	kāfiroñ	ko	un	ka	kufr	na	
badhāy	gā	magar	nuqsān.

arabicText: قُلْ أَرَءَيْتُمْ شُرَكَآءَكُمُ ٱلَّذِينَ تَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ أَرُونِى مَاذَا خَلَقُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلْأَرْضِ أَمْ لَهُمْ شِرْكٌۭ فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ أَمْ ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُمْ كِتَـٰبًۭا فَهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَيِّنَتٍۢ مِّنْهُ ۚ بَلْ إِن يَعِدُ ٱلظَّـٰلِمُونَ بَعْضُهُم بَعْضًا إِلَّا غُرُورًا
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim,	“Just	show	me	your	partners	
(false	deities)	whom	you	worship	other	
than	Allah;	show	me	which	part	of	the	
earth	have	they	created	-	or	do	they	have	
any	share	in	the	heavens?”	Or	have	We	
given	them	some	Book,	so	they	are	on	its	
clear	proofs?	In	fact	the	unjust	do	not	give	
promises	to	each	other,	except	of	deceit.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāō	bhalā	batāō	to	apne	woh	
sharik	jinheñ	Allāh	ke	siwā	poojte	ho	
mujhe	dikhāō	unhoñ	ne	zameen	meiñ	se	
kaunsā	ḥissa	banāyā	yā	āasmānoñ	meiñ	
kuchh	un	ka	sājhā	hai	yā	ham	ne	unheñ	
koyi	kitāb	di	hai	ke	woh	us	ki	roshan	
daliloñ	par	haiñ	balke	zālim	āapas	meiñ	
aik	dosre	ko	w'ada	nahiñ	dete	magar	
fareb	ka.

arabicText: ۞ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُمْسِكُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ أَن تَزُولَا ۚ وَلَئِن زَالَتَآ إِنْ أَمْسَكَهُمَا مِنْ أَحَدٍۢ مِّنۢ بَعْدِهِۦٓ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ حَلِيمًا غَفُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	Allah	restrains	the	heavens	and	
the	earth	from	convulsing;	and	were	they	
to	convulse,	who	could	stop	them	except	
Allah?	Indeed	He	is	Most	Forbearing,	Oft	
Forgiving.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	Allāh	roke	huye	hai	āasmānoñ	
aur	zameen		ko	ke	junbish	na	kare	aur	
agar	woh	hat	jāyeñ	to	unheñ	kaun	roke	
Allāh	ke	siwā	be-shak	woh	ḥilm	wālā	
bakhsh	ne	wālā	hai.

arabicText: وَأَقْسَمُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ جَهْدَ أَيْمَـٰنِهِمْ لَئِن جَآءَهُمْ نَذِيرٌۭ لَّيَكُونُنَّ أَهْدَىٰ مِنْ إِحْدَى ٱلْأُمَمِ ۖ فَلَمَّا جَآءَهُمْ نَذِيرٌۭ مَّا زَادَهُمْ إِلَّا نُفُورًا
englishTranslationText:
And	they	swore	by	Allah	most	vehemently	
in	their	oaths,	that	if	a	Herald	of	Warning	
came	to	them,	they	would	be	more	upon	
guidance	than	any	other	group;	then	
when	a	Herald	of	Warning	did	come	to	
them,	he	increased	nothing	in	them	except	
hatred.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	unhoñ	ne	Allāh	ki	qasam	khāyi	apni	
qasmoñ	meiñ	ḥad	ki	koshish	se	ke	agar	un	
ke	pās	koyi	dar	sunāne	wālā	āayā	to	woh	
zaror	kisi	na	kisi	giroh	se	ziyāda	rāh	par	
hoñ	ge	phir	jab	un	ke	pās	dar	sunāne	wālā	
tashrif	lāyā	to	us	ne	unheñ	na	badhāyā	
magar	nafrat	karnā.

arabicText: ٱسْتِكْبَارًۭا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَكْرَ ٱلسَّيِّئِ ۚ وَلَا يَحِيقُ ٱلْمَكْرُ ٱلسَّيِّئُ إِلَّا بِأَهْلِهِۦ ۚ فَهَلْ يَنظُرُونَ إِلَّا سُنَّتَ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ ۚ فَلَن تَجِدَ لِسُنَّتِ ٱللَّهِ تَبْدِيلًۭا ۖ وَلَن تَجِدَ لِسُنَّتِ ٱللَّهِ تَحْوِيلًا
englishTranslationText:
Priding	themselves	in	the	earth	and	
scheming	evil;	and	the	evil	scheming	falls	only	upon	those	who	scheme	it;	so	what	are	they	
waiting	for,	except	the	tradition	of	the	earlier	nations?	So	you	will	never	find	the	traditions	of	
Allah	changing;	and	you	will	never	find	Allah’s	law	being	avoided.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Apni	jān	ko	zameen	meiñ	ooñchā	khiñchnā	aur	burā	dāōñ	aur	burā	dāōñ	(fareb)	apne	chalne	
wāle	hi	par	padtā	hai	to	kāhe	ke	intizār	meiñ	haiñ	magar	usi	ke	jo	agloñ	ka	dastor	huā	to	tum	
hargiz	Allāh	ke	dastor	ko	badaltā	na	pāōge	aur	hagiz	Allāh	ke	qānoon	ke	taltā	na	pāōge.

arabicText: أَوَلَمْ يَسِيرُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَيَنظُرُوا۟ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ وَكَانُوٓا۟ أَشَدَّ مِنْهُمْ قُوَّةًۭ ۚ وَمَا كَانَ ٱللَّهُ لِيُعْجِزَهُۥ مِن شَىْءٍۢ فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَلَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ عَلِيمًۭا قَدِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	did	they	not	travel	in	the	land	in	order	to	see	what	sort	of	fate	befell	those	who	were	before	
them,	whereas	they	exceeded	them	in	strength?	And	Allah	is	not	such	that	anything	in	the	
heavens	or	in	the	earth	can	break	away	from	His	control;	indeed	He	is	All	Knowing,	Able.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kiyā	unhoñ	ne	zameen	meiñ	safar	na	kiyā	ke	dekhte	un	se	agloñ	ka	kaisā	anjām	huā	aur	
woh	un	se	zor	meiñ	sakht	the	aur	Allāh	woh	nahiñ	jis	ke	qāboo	se	nikal	sake	koyi	shai	
āasmānoñ	aur	zameen	meiñ	be-shak	Woh	Ílm-o-qudrat	wālā	hai.

arabicText: وَلَوْ يُؤَاخِذُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلنَّاسَ بِمَا كَسَبُوا۟ مَا تَرَكَ عَلَىٰ ظَهْرِهَا مِن دَآبَّةٍۢ وَلَـٰكِن يُؤَخِّرُهُمْ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٍۢ مُّسَمًّۭى ۖ فَإِذَا جَآءَ أَجَلُهُمْ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ كَانَ بِعِبَادِهِۦ بَصِيرًۢا
englishTranslationText:
If	Allah	were	to	seize	people	upon	their	
deeds,	He	would	leave	no	creature	
walking	on	the	surface	of	the	earth,	but	He	
gives	them	respite	till	a	fixed	term;	and	
when	their	term	comes	–	so	indeed	Allah	
is	observing	all	His	bondmen!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	Allāh	logoñ	ko	un	ke	kiye	par	
pakadtā	to	zameen	ki	pith	par	koyi	chalne	
wālā	na	chodtā	lekin	aik	muqarrar	mi'āad	
tak	unheñ	dheel	detā	hai	phir	jab	un	ka	
w'ada	āaye	gā	to	be-shak	Allāh	ke	sab	
bande	us	ki	nigāh	meiñ	haiñ.

arabicText: يسٓ
englishTranslationText:
Yaa-Seen*	(*Alphabets	of	the	Arabic	
language;	Allah	and	to	whomever	He	
reveals,	know	their	precise	meanings.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yaa-Seen*	(*Arabi	zabān	ke	Huroof	jinke	
Ma’āni	Allah	aur	Jis	par	Allah	Ta’āla	ne	
Inko	Nazil	Farmaya	Wahi	Janta	hai.)

arabicText: وَٱلْقُرْءَانِ ٱلْحَكِيمِ
englishTranslationText: By	oath	of	the	wise	Qur’an.
romanUrduTranslationText: Hikmat	wāle	Qur’ān	ki	qasam.

arabicText: إِنَّكَ لَمِنَ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
You	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	–	peace	
and	blessings	be	upon	him)	are	indeed	
one	of	the	Noble	Messengers.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	tum	seedhi	rāh

arabicText: عَلَىٰ صِرَٰطٍۢ مُّسْتَقِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText: On	the	Straight	Path.
romanUrduTranslationText: Par	bheje	gaye	ho.

arabicText: تَنزِيلَ ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
englishTranslationText:
(The	Qur’an	is)	Sent	down	by	the	
Almighty,	the	Most	Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText: 'Izzat	wāle	maherbān	ka	utārā	huā.

arabicText: لِتُنذِرَ قَوْمًۭا مَّآ أُنذِرَ ءَابَآؤُهُمْ فَهُمْ غَـٰفِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	that	you	may	warn	these	people	whose	
ancestors	were	not	warned,	they	are	
therefore	unaware.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Take	tum	us	qaum	ko	dar	sunāō	jis	ke	bāp	
dādā	na	darāye	gaye.

arabicText: لَقَدْ حَقَّ ٱلْقَوْلُ عَلَىٰٓ أَكْثَرِهِمْ فَهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Undoubtedly,	it	(their	disbelief)	has	
proved	true	for	most	of	them,	so	they	will	
not	believe.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	woh	be-khabar	haiñ	be-shak	un	meiñ	
aksar	par	bāt	sābit	ho	chuki	hai	to	woh	
imān	na	lāyeñ	ge.

arabicText: إِنَّا جَعَلْنَا فِىٓ أَعْنَـٰقِهِمْ أَغْلَـٰلًۭا فَهِىَ إِلَى ٱلْأَذْقَانِ فَهُم مُّقْمَحُونَ
englishTranslationText:
We	have	indeed	put	shackles	around	their	necks	reaching	up	to	the	chins,	so	they	remain	facing	
upwards.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ham	ne	un	ki	gardanoñ	meiñ	ṭauq	kar	
diye	haiñ	ko	woh	thodiyoñ	tak	haiñ	to	ye	ab	ūpar	ko	muñh	uthāye	rah	gaye.

arabicText: وَجَعَلْنَا مِنۢ بَيْنِ أَيْدِيهِمْ سَدًّۭا وَمِنْ خَلْفِهِمْ سَدًّۭا فَأَغْشَيْنَـٰهُمْ فَهُمْ لَا يُبْصِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	have	set	a	wall	before	them	and	a	wall	behind	them,	and	covered	the	top	-	so	they	are	
unable	to	see	anything.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Ham	ne	un	ke	āage	deewār	banā	di	aur	un	ke	pichhe	aik	deewār	aur	unheñ	ūpar	se	dhānk	
diyā	to	unheñ	kuchh	nahiñ	soojhtā.

arabicText: وَسَوَآءٌ عَلَيْهِمْ ءَأَنذَرْتَهُمْ أَمْ لَمْ تُنذِرْهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	it	is	the	same	for	them,	whether	you	warn	them	or	do	not	warn	them	-	they	will	not	believe.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	unheñ	aik	sā	hai	tum	unheñ	darāō	yā	na	drāō	woh	Imān	lāne	ke	nahiñ.

arabicText: إِنَّمَا تُنذِرُ مَنِ ٱتَّبَعَ ٱلذِّكْرَ وَخَشِىَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنَ بِٱلْغَيْبِ ۖ فَبَشِّرْهُ بِمَغْفِرَةٍۢ وَأَجْرٍۢ كَرِيمٍ
englishTranslationText:
You	warn	only	him	who	follows	the	advice	and	fears	the	Most	Gracious	without	seeing;	
therefore	give	him	glad	tidings	of	forgiveness	and	an	honourable	reward.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	to	usi	ko	dar	sunāte	ho	jo	nasiḥat	par	chale	aur	raḥmān	se	be	dekhe	dare	to	use	bakhshish	
aur	'izzat	ke	sawāb	ki	bashārat	do.

arabicText: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نُحْىِ ٱلْمَوْتَىٰ وَنَكْتُبُ مَا قَدَّمُوا۟ وَءَاثَـٰرَهُمْ ۚ وَكُلَّ شَىْءٍ أَحْصَيْنَـٰهُ فِىٓ إِمَامٍۢ مُّبِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
We	will	surely	bring	the	dead	to	life	and	We	record	what	they	send	ahead	and	the	signs	they	
will	leave	behind;	and	We	have	accounted	all	things	in	a	clear	Book.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	Ham	murdoñ	ko	jilāyeñ	(zinda	kareñ)	ge	aur	Ham	likh	rahe	haiñ	jo	unhoñ	ne	āage	
bhejā	aur	jo	nishāniyāñ	pichhe	chhod	gaye	aur	har	cheez	ham	ne	gin	rakhi	hai	aik	batāne	wāli	
kitāb	meiñ.

arabicText: وَٱضْرِبْ لَهُم مَّثَلًا أَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلْقَرْيَةِ إِذْ جَآءَهَا ٱلْمُرْسَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	relate	to	them	the	signs	of	the	people	
of	the	city	-	when	two	emissaries	came	to	
them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	se	misāl	bayān	karo	us	shahar	
wāloñ	ki	jab	un	ke	pās	Firistāde	āaye.

arabicText: إِذْ أَرْسَلْنَآ إِلَيْهِمُ ٱثْنَيْنِ فَكَذَّبُوهُمَا فَعَزَّزْنَا بِثَالِثٍۢ فَقَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّآ إِلَيْكُم مُّرْسَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
When	We	had	sent	two	towards	them	and	
they	denied	them	both,	so	We	fortified	
them	with	a	third,	and	they	all	said,	
“Indeed	we	have	been	sent	to	you.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jab	Ham	ne	un	ki	ṭaraf	do	bheje	phir	
unhoñ	ne	un	ko	jhutlāyā	to	ham	ne	teesre	
se	zor	diyā	ab	un	sab	ne	kahā	ke	be-shak	
ham	tumhāri	ṭaraf	bheje	gaye	haiñ.

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ مَآ أَنتُمْ إِلَّا بَشَرٌۭ مِّثْلُنَا وَمَآ أَنزَلَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ مِن شَىْءٍ إِنْ أَنتُمْ إِلَّا تَكْذِبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“You	are	nothing	but	mortals	like	
us;	the	Most	Gracious	has	not	sent	down	
anything	-	you	are	nothing	but	liars.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	tum	to	nahiñ	magar	ham	jaise	āadmi	
aur	Raḥmān	ne	kuch	nahiñ	utārā	tum	nire	
jhoote	ho.

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ رَبُّنَا يَعْلَمُ إِنَّآ إِلَيْكُمْ لَمُرْسَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	answered,	“Our	Lord	knows	that	
surely,	without	doubt,	we	have	been	sent	
towards	you.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	bole	hamārā	Rab	jānta	hai	ke	be
shak	zaror	ham	tumhāri	ṭaraf	bheje	gaye	
haiñ.

arabicText: وَمَا عَلَيْنَآ إِلَّا ٱلْبَلَـٰغُ ٱلْمُبِينُ
englishTranslationText:
“And	our	duty	is	nothing	but	to	plainly	
convey	(the	message).”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	hamāre	ƶimme	nahiñ	magar	sāf	
pahuñchā	denā.

arabicText: قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا تَطَيَّرْنَا بِكُمْ ۖ لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهُوا۟ لَنَرْجُمَنَّكُمْ وَلَيَمَسَّنَّكُم مِّنَّا عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
They	(the	people	of	the	city)	said,	“We	
think	you	are	ominous;	indeed,	if	you	do	
not	desist,	we	shall	surely	stone	you	to	
death,	and	you	will	surely	face	a	grievous	
torture	at	our	hands.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	ham	tumheñ	manḥoos	samajhte	haiñ	
be-shak	tum	agar	b’az	na	āaye	to	zaroor	
tumheñ	sangsār	kareñ	ge	be-shak	hamāre	
hāthoñ	tum	par	dukh	ki	mār	pade	gi

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ طَـٰٓئِرُكُم مَّعَكُمْ ۚ أَئِن ذُكِّرْتُم ۚ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌۭ مُّسْرِفُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“Your	evil	omens	are	with	you!	
What!	You	get	annoyed	for	being	advised?	
In	fact	you	are	a	people	who	transgress	
the	limits!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Unhoñ	ne	farmāyā	tumhāri	naḥoosat	to	
tumhāre	sāth	hai	kyā	is	par	bidakte	ho	ke	
tum	samjhāye	gaye	balke	tum	ḥad	se	
badhne	wāle	log	ho.
